newsitem.title: INDIA: India gold ends lower on fresh supply, silver dips.
newsitem.headline: India gold ends lower on fresh supply, silver dips.

text.p: ** Gold 24 carat closes 20 rupees lower at 4,720 rupees per 10 gramme
** Gold biscuit (116.50 gramme) closes 300 rupees lower at 55,200 rupees against the previous close of 55,500 rupees
** Silver (.999) closes five rupees lower at 7,335 rupees per kg against the previous close of 7,340 rupees
Gold 24 carat closed 20 rupees lower at 4,720 rupees per 10 gramme against the previous close of 4,740 rupees on the back of fresh arrivals and sluggish seasonal buying, dealers said.
"Daily arrivals of imported gold through official and unofficial channels in Bombay has risen to 400/500 kgs," one broker said. He said a weak trend in the global market also prompted profit-taking
Gold biscuit (116.50 gramme) closed 300 rupees lower at 55,200 against the previous close of 55,500 rupees.
It was up by 100 rupees per piece on Thursday.

Silver (.999) closed five rupees lower at 7,335 rupees per kg against the previous close of 7,340 rupees amid slow industrial buying and limited activity. Silver was up by 60 rupees per kg on Thursday.
Limited arrivals of silver in Bombay as helped market to consolidate recent gains but sentiments at the close was subdued because of a downtrend in the world market, traders said.
The Bombay Bullion market will remain closed on Monday for Holi festival (festival of colour). (Conversion $1=35.88 rupees)
